                                          '<i>Yes</i> if it describes the '
                                          'child and <i>No</i> if it does not. '
                                          'Use your knowledge of the child as '
                                          'well as information obtained from '

                                          'You are required to answer every '
                                          'item, even if it asks about skills '

                                          'ask whether the child <i>does</i> '
                                          'perform a task. To score '
                                          '<i>Yes</i>, the child must not only '
                                          'be able to perform the task, he or '
                                          'she must actually perform it some '
                                          'of the time. However, some '
                                          'questions ask whether the child '
                                          '<i>can</i> perform a task. For '
                                          'these questions, a <i>Yes</i> means '
                                          'that the child has shown the '
                                          'ability to perform the task at '
                                          'least once.<br><br>Some questions '
                                          'ask about skills or behaviors that '
                                          'the child mastered long ago and '
                                          'does not do anymore; for example, '
                                          '“Does the child sometimes imitate '
                                          'spoken words, such as saying '
                                          '‘da-da’ or ‘ma-ma’?” The child may '
                                          'have imitated words when younger '
                                          'and now uses more advanced speech. '
                                          'You would answer <i>Yes</i> to this '
                                          'question because the child '
                                          'successfully did so in the '
                                          'past.<br><br>Please answer '
                                          '<i>Yes</i> or <i>No</i> to the '
                                          'question exactly as it is written. '
                                          'For example, if the child cannot '
                                          'speak but uses sign language, you '
                                          'must still respond <i>No</i> to '
                                          'questions about speaking words, '
                                          'even if the child can sign them. '
                                          'However, you may respond <i>Yes</i> '
                                          'to questions that ask about '
                                          'communication and don’t specify '
                                          'speaking.<br><br>If you are not '
                                          'sure whether to answer an item '
                                          '<i>Yes</i> or <i>No</i>, please '
                                          'make your best '
                                          'guess.<br><br><b>Optional Start and '
                                          'Stop Rules</b><br>If you wish to '
                                          'use Start and Stop rules, please '
                                          'refer to the “Administration of the '
                                          'Parent/Caregiver Interview Form” '
                                          'section in Chapter 2 of the DP-4 '
                                          'manual, which describes how to '
                                          'satisfy these rules.'},
    'Parent/Caregiver Checklist': {   'Directions': 'Read each question and '
                                                    'answer <i>Yes</i> if it '
                                                    'describes your child and '
                                                    '<i>No</i> if it does not. '

                                                    'answer every item, even '
                                                    'if it asks about skills '

    'Teacher Checklist': {   'Directions': 'Read each question and answer '
                                           '<i>Yes</i> if it describes the '
                                           'child and <i>No</i> if it does '
                                           'not. You are required to answer '
                                           'every item, even if it asks about '
                                           'skills or behaviors typical of a '
                                           'child much older or younger than '
                                           'the child.<br><br><b>Scoring '
                                           'Tips</b><br>Most of the questions '
                                           'ask whether the child <i>does</i> '
                                           'perform a task. To score '
                                           '<i>Yes</i>, the child must not '
                                           'only be able to perform the task, '
                                           'he or she must actually perform it '
                                           'some of the time. However, some '
                                           'questions ask whether the child '
                                           '<i>can</i> perform a task. For '
                                           'these questions, a <i>Yes</i> '
                                           'means that the child has shown the '
                                           'ability to perform the task at '
                                           'least once.<br><br>Some questions '
                                           'ask about skills or behaviors that '
                                           'the child mastered long ago and '
                                           'does not do anymore; for example, '
                                           '“Does the child sometimes imitate '
                                           'spoken words, such as saying '
                                           '‘da-da’ or ‘ma-ma’?” The child may '
                                           'have imitated words when younger '
                                           'and now uses more advanced speech. '
                                           'You would answer <i>Yes</i> to '
                                           'this question because the child '
                                           'successfully did so in the '
                                           'past.<br><br>Please answer '
                                           '<i>Yes</i> or <i>No</i> to the '
                                           'question exactly as it is written. '
                                           'For example, if the child cannot '
                                           'speak but uses sign language, you '
                                           'must still respond <i>No</i> to '
                                           'questions about speaking words, '
                                           'even if the child can sign them. '
                                           'However, you may respond '
                                           '<i>Yes</i> to questions that ask '
                                           'about communication and don’t '
                                           'specify speaking.<br><br>  If you '
                                           'are not sure whether to answer '
                                           '<i>Yes</i> or <i>No</i>, please '
                                           'make your best guess.'}}

questionTextList = {   'Clinician Rating': {   'Adaptive Behavior Scale': {   'q1': 'Does the '
                                                                 'child '
                                                                 'intentionally '
                                                                 'swat away '
                                                                 'something '
                                                                 'that is in '
                                                                 'his or her '
                                                                 'way? For '
                                                                 'example, a '
                                                                 'blanket over '
                                                                 'the eyes or '
                                                                 'hair in the '
                                                                 'face.',
                                                           'q10': 'Can the '
                                                                  'child use a '
                                                                  'fork for '
                                                                  'eating '
                                                                  'solid '
